data.title: Diagonal Cross Word
data.solution:
s = input()
n = len(s)
for i, ch in enumerate(s):
    row = [" "] * n
    row[i] = ch
    row[(n-1) - i] = s[-1 - i]
    print("".join(row))
data.statement:

- A first diagonal (from top-left to bottom-right) containing the characters of [[s]] in order
- A second diagonal (from top-right to bottom-left) containing the characters of [[s]] in reverse order
- All other cells shall contain spaces (" ")

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string s of length n, construct an n × n grid containing:
- A first diagonal (from top-left to bottom-right) containing the characters of s in order
- A second diagonal (from top-right to bottom-left) containing the characters of s in reverse order
- All other cells shall contain spaces (" ")
Input
A string s consisting of printable non-whitespace characters.
Output
A n x n printed grid containing two diagonal made of s characters in order and reverse order.
Constraints
1 ≤ n
s contains only printable ASCII characters without spaces
Example
Input
HELLO
Output
H   O
 E L 
  L  
 E L 
H   O
